item.title: ECB to Impose First-Ever Fines on Banks for Climate Failures
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank is set to take the unprecedented step of imposing fines on several lenders for their protracted failure to address the impact of climate change. As many as four lenders face penalties after not meeting deadlines set by the ECB for assessing their exposure to ...

item.title: German Inflation Edges Up Again, Highlighting ECB Challenge
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- German inflation quickened for a second month – underscoring the task for the European Central Bank to achieve its 2% target as it prepares to lower interest rates next week. Consumer prices rose 2.8% from a year ago in May, the statistics office said Wednesday. That’s up from 2.4% in...

item.title: ECB Should Not ‘Autopilot’ Into Rate Cuts, Says Kazaks
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank shouldn’t switch to “autopilot” in cutting interest rates following an expected first move next week, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks. A dependence on incoming economic data is “still key,” the Latvian official said Wednesday in a present...

item.title: BlackRock’s $20 Billion ETF Is Now the World’s Largest Bitcoin Fund
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc.’s iShares Bitcoin Trust has become the world’s largest fund for the original cryptocurrency, amassing almost $20 billion in total assets since listing in the US at the start of the year. The exchange-traded fund held $19.68 billion of the token Tuesday, dethroning the $...

item.title: ECB’s Vujcic Faces Uncertain Future With New Term in the Balance
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Croatia’s new government is throwing the future of the country’s central bank chief into question at a critical juncture for euro-zone interest rates. The administration, which took power this month, has until July 13 to decide whether to hand the 59-year-old Boris Vujcic a third six-...

item.title: In Greifbares Investieren
item.author: Börsen-Kurier
item.description: Genau genommen vermittelt die Titulierung von „Sachwerte-Fonds“ kein konkretes Anlageprofil. Gelten doch bereits Aktien als Sachwerte an sich. Doch abgesehen von Geldmarktfonds genießen Sachwerte herkömmlich den Nimbus einer sicheren bzw. auch (körperlich) greifbaren Wertanlage. Mit dem prägenden Be...

item.author: cash.ch

item.title: AXA Real Estate Fund Switzerland erhöht Kapital um bis zu 280 Millionen Franken
item.author: cash.ch
item.description: Der Emissionspreis setzt sich den Angaben zufolge aus dem Nettoinventarwert des AXA Real Estate Fund Switzerland per 31. item.title: China fördert eigene KI-Chips mit Milliarden-Hilfen
item.author: FOCUS online
item.description: China hat einen staatlichen Fonds zur Förderung von KI-Chips ins Leben gerufen, wie CNBC berichtet. Die Einrichtung konzentriere sich auf fortschrittliche Chips für die künstliche Intelligenz (AI). China wolle bei Entwicklung und Produktion die gesamte Lieferkette abdecken. item.description:

item.title: Die UBS bekennt sich vorbehaltlos zu Asien
